question_description: What is the filing date? DD/MM/YYYY
Does this judgment concern an interlocutory applicatidoes this judgment concern an interlocutory application? Answer "yes", "no" or "unclear" on?
If the judgment concerns an interlocutory application, what was the date of the application?  DD/MM/YYYY
what was the deceased's name?
when did the deceased die? DD/MM/YYYY

had the deceased committed misconduct against any of the parties to the case? Reply with "alleged", "found" or "neither", and provide a citation of the paragraphs or paragraph where the misconduct is described.
identify every will, codicil and revocation mentioned in the case and the dates when these were made
who is the executor or administrator of the deceased's estate?
who is are the legal representatives, if any, of the executor or adminstrator?
what sections of the Succession Act or Family Provision Act are mentioned?
Example: Family Provision Act 1982: 1. S6. Definition of "eligible person"; 2. S7 Provision for maintenance, education, or advancement in life; 3. S9 Provisions affecting the Court's powers under sections 7 and 8.

question_description: what other claims did the plaintiff argue, aside from the Succession Act? For example, presumed undue influence, actual undue influence, incapacity
Example: The plaintiff argued claims under the Property (Relationships) Act 1984.

question_description: were the plaintiff's claims successful? Answer "yes" or "no"
what provision did the court award?
did the parties have a dispute about their costs? Answer "yes", "no" or "unclear"
what was the amount of costs in the dispute, if any?
which party or parties were liable for costs?
did the parties participate in mediation or any other alternative dispute resolution?
if the parties participated in mediation or alternative dispute resolution, on what date did this take place? DD/MM/YYYY or n/a
what are all of the assets which make up the deceased's estate?
what is the monetary value of the estate, if stated?
is the family or matrimonial home in dispute?
did the court designate any property as notional estate?
how is the deceased's estate distributed according to the last will or intestacy rules?
What is the party's full name?
What is the party's role in the trial - plaintiff, defendant, respondent, executor, etc.
Who are the party's legal representatives?
What is the amount of the costs incurred by this party, if any?
Is the party a natural person?
What was the party's relationship to the deceased?
Was the party dependant on the deceased?
Had the party committed misconduct against the deceased, and if so, what?
Was the party estranged from the deceased?
What are the party's financial circumstances?
What are the party's family and personal circumstances?
Has the party engaged in any illegal behaviour, and, if so, what?
Does the party have a conditional or contingent fee agreement with their legal representatives?
